definition: finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
to transmit/to lead/to guide/to conduct/to direct

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: I'm certain every mentor agreed with her words.
sentences.chinese: 我敢保证每个指导者都会同意她的话。

sentences.english: The mentor said nothing, and took much pride in his students.
sentences.chinese: 指导者什么都没说，并对他的学生感到很自豪。

sentences.english: And the higher you go in leadership, the more mentors you should have.
sentences.chinese: 你在领导能力上位阶越高，你应该要有更多的指导者。

sentences.english: This is the moment to switch your role from doer to guider.
sentences.chinese: 这是你从行为者成为指导者过渡的时刻。

sentences.english: So the wise mentor will avoid leading the customer, until later.
sentences.chinese: 因此明智的指导者直到后来一直都避免引导客户。

sentences.english: Boohoo :P Talk to the trainer again when ready for the next step in your quest.
sentences.chinese: 再一次和指导者说话，为下一个任务做准备。

sentences.english: Some guidance from the mentor may be required.
sentences.chinese: 可能需要来自指导者的一些指导。

sentences.english: Carp saw, and for an instant the sternness of the instructor left his face.
sentences.chinese: 卡普见了，一瞬间严厉的指导者神情离开了他的脸庞。

sentences.english: Every mentor knows the hard realities of an enablement unsupported by local management.
sentences.chinese: 每个指导者都知道本地管理层不支持的残酷现实。

sentences.english: As stated before, the mentor must be listening.
sentences.chinese: 如前面所述的一样，指导者必须聆听。

sentences.english: Where are the souls and guides that you anchor at war with one another or dissonant with one another?
sentences.chinese: 你锚定的灵魂和指导者在哪里互相战争或互相冲突？

sentences.english: Think of them as your design competition creative director.
sentences.chinese: 把他们试想成设计竞赛的指导者。
